title: Peter Greste family say he 'won't give up' until al-Jazeera colleagues are free - as it happened | Media | The Guardian
summary: `` he wo n't give up until baher and mohamed fahmy are out of there ''
no date for greste 's return to australia has been set .
peter greste is a free man ''

text: we 'll end our live coverage there .
my colleague in brisbane , josh robertson , attended the news conference .
he 'll have a full report up shortly .
joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) happiness personified : the greste family celebrate peter 's release # freeajstaff
the press conference is wrapping up now .
on closer inspection , juris greste is wearing a red fedora , a matching shirt , and red and blue tartan golf pants .
we 're endeavouring to bring you photographs , but here 's one from twitter .
rebecca armitage ( @ becarmitage ) a very happy juris greste rocks his steeziest outfit at his family 's news conference in brisbane # freeajstaff mad swag .
q : do you foresee a time when he might go back to egypt ?
lois greste : i do n't see it . ''

documents.title: `` he wo n't give up until baher and mohamed fahmy are out of there ''
text: andrew adds that peter will embrace his status as a mantle of press freedom and will likely try to further that cause : i think he 's genuinely passionate and he 's a committed journalist who believes in the principles of what you guys do and the importance of good journalism to a free , functioning democracy .
so there 's no doubt that he will devote some of his time and energy to that cause and i think - straight up , he 's not going to forget his two other colleagues .
there 's no doubt that his excitement is tempered and restrained and will be until those guys are free .
he wo n't give up until baher and mohamed fahmy are out of there .

juris greste sends this message to baher mohamed and mohamed fahmy , who remain behind bars : [ i want to ] assure them that while obviously peter is foremost in our mind , let it be known that we think about them still every moment of the day and expect that they will be able to have jubilant moment like this very , very soon .
we do feel very deeply for them , we have met their families , they are lovely people and it is sad that it 's happened to them as much as it 's been an overwhelming desperate thing for us too .
asked if peter will be allowed to venture overseas again once he returns to australia , andrew says : not for a little while . ''
we 'll try and keep him here as long as possible .
he only gets one crack at this .
only gets one crack at it out of me , anyway . ''
andrew greste says it 's unclear what actually prompted peter 's release overnight .
i guess we 'll never know what the key point is , what the trigger point , what the turning point was really , to get him out .
i do n't know , but obviously we 're very grateful .

i think that there 's been a countless number of dedicated people that have contributed in all sorts of different ways and i know we 're going to miss naming and acknowledging them but i just am eternally grateful for all of that support and the effort that people have provided , from merely sharing a tweet to some kind of protest or action , visible action , to writing letters to the diplomatic work and the work of the media and the legal guys .
he suggests it 's a question to ask the egyptians .

documents.title: no date for greste 's return to australia has been set
text: q : when are you expecting him back here in brisbane ?
lois greste : when he 's ready to come back and not before .
it 's been 18 months since he was in australia , she adds .
we 're told that mike and peter celebrated last night in cyprus with beer and pork ( two of the rarer commodities in egyptian prison , '' andrew greste quips ) .
his mother , lois : i 'm ecstatic .
i just ca n't say how happy i am about it .
very excited and pleased .
it 's also difficult to realise that this day has actually come .
even though i sort of dreamed about it quietly , not daring to think about it too much , it 's arrived now .
lois greste in brisbane
andrew says that peter has been in cyrus for less than six hours and is resting and gathering his thoughts .

as much as we 've tried to keep him up to date with the campaign and what 's been going on and the people involved in it and who we 've been working with , he 's been living the last 400 days in a very insular confined space with very limited information , so it 's going to take him a little bit of time to absorb what has actually occurred and the enormity of what 's occurred today .
i think we just got to respect his privacy and give him a little bit of time to readjust because it 's going to take a little bit of effort to manage .
obviously he 's on a high right now but we want to make sure that things are kept at a fairly manageable and , you know , good level .

juris greste , who might i say is dressed sensationally , has also spoken : there are thousands upon thousands of people that we all as a family want to thank and peter will want to thank , but andrew has already made mention of our diplomatic crew in egypt .
while we are in a knighthood mode , dare i say , i would commend them and recommend them for ac ollective knighthood one and all from dr ralph king right down to mahmoud , the driver .
they have done an absolutely stirling job as andrew said .
andrew greste has thanked the australian foreign minister , julie bishop , the ambassador to egypt , dr ralph king , and a long list of others who helped secure peter 's freedom .
he also thanks the greste family 's local fixer , who would have to be one of my best mates '' .

i do n't want to name him for his own sake but he would do anything for me and i just could n't have - we could n't have functioned in cairo without that guy and without his group of lieutenants that helped us along the way .
he goes on : on a more sombre note , we also - and i know peter sincerely wanted me to mention this point , that we want to acknowledge that peter 's two other colleagues are still there .
peter was arrested with baher mohamed and mohamed fahmy , they also deserve to be free .
peter wo n't rest until they 're released from prison , and we hope that will follow in the very near future .

and of course we are thinking of baher mohamed and their families who thankfully , in this unusual twist of fate , that we 've got to know very well and we offer our unconditional support to you and hope your struggle will end very soon .

documents.title: peter greste is a free man ''
text: peter greste is a free man , '' announces andrew greste .
he is currently with our brother mike in cyprus where he is gathering his thoughts for the trip home .
he is safe , healthy , very , very happy to be on his way home .
we have spoken with him recently and peter firstly wanted to thank all the people who have supported him who have given time , money , and energy in seeking his freedom .
andrew greste speaks in brisbane

as we await a press conference from peter greste 's parents juris and lois , here are some remarks from the australian foreign minister , julie bishop , who spoke with the reporter earlier this morning .
i spoke to peter greste shortly after his release and before he departed egypt , '' she told reporters in sydney on monday .
he was immensely relieved and he was desperate to come home to australia and reunite with his family .
from my discussion with him , he was very keen to be back on a beach and lying in the sun in australia , '' she said .
greste left cairo on an egyptair flight to larnaca , cyprus , which took off shortly after 4pm local time on sunday ( around 1am aedt on monday ) .
al-jazeera , echoing other statements , has welcomed greste 's release but condemned the continued incarceration of his colleagues .
we 're pleased for peter and his family that they are to be reunited .
it has been an incredible and unjustifiable ordeal for them , and they have coped with incredible dignity .
peter 's integrity is not just intact , but has been further enhanced by the fortitude and sacrifice he has shown for his profession of informing the public .
we will not rest until baher and mohamed also regain their freedom .
the egyptian authorities have it in their power to finish this properly today , and that is exactly what they must do .

andy carvin ( @ acarvin ) al jazeera press statement on the release of peter greste : # egypt the arrest of the three journalists occurred in the context of soured relations between egypt and al-jazeera 's owner , the state of qatar , which is generally supportive of the muslim brotherhood , the islamist party that ran egypt until it was overthrown in july 2013 .
but ties between the two states are improving , and in december , qatar agreed to shut down a pro-islamist tv channel that was infuriating the military-backed authorities in cairo .

here 's more from my colleague patrick kingsley : al-jazeera , which is owned by the qatari royal family , announced on monday that its affiliate mubasher misr ( egypt direct ) was ceasing broadcast immediately until conditions are favourable '' for it to return to egypt , where it was banned last year .

egyptians had long demanded that qatar shut down mubasher misr , whose coverage favoured morsi and which was one of the few remaining arabic channels to give voice to brotherhood supporters and to challenge widening state repression .
one pro-regime newspaper maintained a feature called the jazeera-meter , which tracked the extent to which mubasher was softening its line .

before the channel 's closure , sameh seif elyazal , a former general and now head of the gomhouria centre for political and security studies , said : it 's a big headache for ordinary egyptians , not only for the egyptian government .
if they shut it down , that would be a first step . ''

the channel 's coverage had softened perceptibly recently , referring to sisi as his excellency the president '' in place of its previous description of him as the first elected president after the coup '' .
read the full report here
human rights groups have welcomed greste 's release but urged the world to remain focused on political repression in egypt , which commentators suggest has returned to endemic levels .

here 's the director of human rights watch australia , elaine pearson : it 's great news that the government has released peter greste , but his al jazeera colleagues mohamed fahmy and baher mohamed should also be freed immediately .
international attention should remain fixed on the journalists currently unjustly imprisoned in egypt until the government frees them and drops politically motivated charges .

hassiba hadj sahraoui , amnesty international 's deputy director for the middle east and north africa : the news that peter greste will finally be allowed to leave egypt after more than a year in prison comes as a welcome relief , but nothing can make up for his ordeal .

it is vital that in the celebratory fanfare surrounding his deportation the world does not forget the continuing ordeal of baher mohamed and mohamed fahmy who remain behind bars at tora prison in cairo .
all three men are facing trumped up charges and were forced to endure a farcical trial marred by irregularities .
continuing to detain baher mohamed and mohamed fahmy is completely unjust and unwarranted .
it has become increasingly clear that the journalists have been used as political pawns in a dispute between the authorities of egypt and the qatar government , which owns the al jazeera network .
it is unacceptable that the lives of these men have been so carelessly toyed with .

my colleague patrick kingsley has more on the incarceration of political prisoners in egypt : according to the police 's own figures , fahmy and mohamed remain among at least 16,000 political prisoners currently detained in egypt .
independent estimates put the figure at about 40,000 .

the intense international focus on peter greste has led the supporters of his many fellow inmates to remind the outside world that his release is only a small gesture in the context of egypt 's wider crackdown on dissent .
there are at least 11 other journalists in jail in egypt , according to us-based independent organisation the committee to protect journalists , with some estimates rising far higher .
with little public profile , many of them lament how there is no international campaign to shine a light on their case .

a file photograph dated 04 february 2014 shows a nairobi-based foreign correspondent posing with a placard to protest against imprisonment of al jazeera journalists peter greste and his colleagues in egypt , outside the egyptian embassy in nairobi , kenya .
kurokawa/epa
good morning .
there was terrific news in the past few hours that jailed al-jazeera reporter peter greste has been released from an egyptian prison after 400 days behind bars .
here 's the story from my colleague patrick kingsley in cairo : mike greste confirmed that the australian journalist had arrived in cyprus and said he would issue a full statement later on .
an interior ministry spokesman had earlier confirmed peter greste 's deportation under a recently enacted decree .
a presidential decree has been issued to deport him to continue his punishment period in australia .
the foreign ministry co-ordinated with the australian embassy and his plane took off at 4.10pm [ local time ] , '' he said .
greste was arrested in a cairo hotel room in december 2013 with two colleagues , mohamed fahmy and baher mohamed .
the trio were charged with endangering egypt 's national security , aiding terrorists , and doctoring footage .
they were convicted in a trial widely denounced as a farce and sentenced to seven years in prison .
mohamed , who holds egyptian citizenship , received an additional three years .
an appeals judge appeared to acknowledged the drawbacks of the first trial and ordered a re-run earlier this month .

greste and fahmy , meanwhile , applied for deportation under a presidential decree issued by the egyptian leader , abdel fattah el-sisi , that allowed foreign prisoners to be sent home in exceptional cases .
the suggestion was that the decree was issued as a means to free greste and fahmy and relieve the egyptian government of what had become a cause celèbre in the international arena .

al-jazeera english producer baher mohamed , left , canadian-egyptian acting cairo bureau chief mohammed fahmy , center , and correspondent peter greste , right , appear in court along with several other defendants during their trial on terror charges , in cairo , egypt .
elkholy/ap fahmy , a canadian who gave us his joint egyptian citizenship , is still detained in cairo 's notorious tora prison , but egyptian authorities say his release too is imminent .
there 's no word on whether mohamed will be freed .
greste 's parents lois and juris will be giving a press conference in brisbane in about 25 minutes .
we 'll cover that live and pull in reactions around australia and the world .

12.09am GMT
00:09
“Peter Greste is a free man"

bulletin.text: The Greste family speaks in Brisbane about the end of their son's 400-day ordeal, as concerns remain for his colleagues Baher Mohamed and Mohamed Fahmy.
